Class Date

  • java.lang.Object
    • Date
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Date>

    public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Date>
    The class represents a specific day and provides comparisons between other Date objects.
    Author:
    Alan Wernick

    • Constructor Detail

      • Date

        public Date(java.lang.String string)
        Accepts a string with the following format: mm dd, yyyy. The month parameter is a bit more lenient, and allows for different formats such as the full month name, abbreviations, or digit representation.
        Parameters:
        string - string representation of a day with format mm dd, yyyy

    • Method Detail

      • setMonth

        private void setMonth(java.lang.String month)
               throws InvalidDateException
        Sets the month based on a string representation. This method converts a string into a digit representation of the month.
        Parameters:
        month - month name or abbreviation.
        Throws:
        InvalidDateException - thrown if the string does not match any months.

      • setMonth

        private void setMonth(int month)
               throws InvalidDateException
        Sets the digit representation of a month.
        Parameters:
        month - month in digit format
        Throws:
        InvalidDateException - thrown if the month value is not valid

      • setDay

        private void setDay(int day)
             throws InvalidDateException
        Sets the day.
        Parameters:
        day - day in digit format
        Throws:
        InvalidDateException - thrown if the day is greater than the amount of days in the month

      • setYear

        private void setYear(int year)
        Sets the year
        Parameters:
        year - year value

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks if the date constructed is valid or not.
        Returns:
        true if the date is valid, false otherwise.
